org.accada.epcis.repository
Class QueryOperationsModule

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.epcis.repository.QueryOperationsModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EPCISServicePortType
public class QueryOperationsModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EPCISServicePortType

EPCIS Query Operations Module implementing the SOAP/HTTP binding of the Query Control Interface. The implementation converts invocations from Axis into SQL queries and returns the results back to the requesting client through Axis.

Author:
David Gubler, Alain Remund, Arthur van Dorp, Marco Steybe

Constructor Detail

QueryOperationsModule

public QueryOperationsModule()
Constructs a new QueryOperationsModule. Reads the properties from the passed message context, which is set by the QueryInitHandler's invoke method.

subscribe

public org.accada.epcis.soapapi.VoidHolder subscribe(org.accada.epcis.soapapi.Subscribe parms)
                                              throws org.accada.epcis.soapapi.ImplementationException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.InvalidURIException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.SubscribeNotPermittedException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.SubscriptionControlsException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.ValidationException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.DuplicateSubscriptionException,
                                                     org.accada.epcis.soapapi.NoSuchNameException
Subscribes a query.

Specified by:
subscribe in interface org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EPCISServicePortType
Parameters:
parms - A Subscribe object containing the query to be subscribed..
Returns:
Nothing.
Throws:
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.ImplementationException - If a problem with the EPCIS implementation occured.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.InvalidURIException - If an invalid URI where the query results should be posted is provided.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.SubscribeNotPermittedException - If a SimpleMasterDataQuery is provided which is only valid for polling.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.SubscriptionControlsException - If one of the SubscriptionControls parameters is not set.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.ValidationException - If the query is not valid.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.DuplicateSubscriptionException - If a query with the given ID is already subscribed.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.NoSuchNameException - If a query name is not implemented yet.
See Also:
EPCISServicePortType.subscribe(org.accada.epcis.soapapi.Subscribe)

Runs (polls) a query.

Specified by:
poll in interface org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EPCISServicePortType
Parameters:
parms - The query to poll.
Returns:
A QueryResults object containing the result of the query.
Throws:
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.ImplementationException - If a problem with the EPCIS implementation occured.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.QueryTooLargeException - If the query is too large.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.QueryParameterException - If one of the query parameters is invalid.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.NoSuchNameException - If an invalid query type was provided.
org.accada.epcis.soapapi.QueryTooComplexException - If a query takes too long to return.
See Also:
EPCISServicePortType.poll(org.accada.epcis.soapapi.Poll)

public java.lang.String getVendorVersion(org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EmptyParms parms)
Returns the vendor version.

Specified by:
getVendorVersion in interface org.accada.epcis.soapapi.EPCISServicePortType
Parameters:
parms - An empty parameter.
Returns:
The vendor version. The empty string indicates that the implementation implements only standard functionality with no vendor extensions.
